H0.text: Cilia are tiny hairs that line the bronchi.

H1.text: Antennae are the tiny hairs that line the bronchi.

H2.text: Alveoli are tiny hairs that line the bronchi.

H3.text: Flagella are tiny hairs that line the bronchi.

A4.text: Motile cilia are found in large numbers on respiratory epithelial cells â€“ around 200 cilia per cell, where they function in mucociliary clearance, and also have mechanosensory and chemosensory functions.
